alert.note: Alert for Big Stone (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 5:13AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER RETURNS TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY... Low pressure moving across the region tonight through Thursday will spread snowfall from south central through northeast South Dakota into west central Minnesota. Generally 1 to 3 inches can be expected. Initially, pockets of light freezing rain and sleet are possible, which may bring a light coating of ice for some areas. Late tonight and through the day Thursday, strong northerly winds will develop, with gusts over 40 mph likely across the region. This will lead to areas of blowing and drifting snow, with low visibility making travel hazardous. This is especially likely in the areas that receive a fresh 1 to 3 inches of snow late tonight into Thursday morning.
